long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: gkrellm has an unusable pkgconfig file
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 2.3.6-0.1.rc1.git20160226
How reproducible: always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install gkrellm-devel 2. Make some pkg-config query about gkrellm, e.g. "pkg-config --cflags gkrellm"
Actual results: Error message "Package 'gkrellm' has no Name: field"
Expected results: No error message, proper information returned
Additional info: none
gkrellm-2.3.7-2.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-bc378ac586
gkrellm-2.3.7-2.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-5f227d4156
Can you add also the "Libs:" line to the pkgconfig file? It is missing, while it exists in version 2.3.5.

(In reply to Alexandre Silva Lopes from comment #3) > Can you add also the "Libs:" line to the pkgconfig file? It is missing, > while it exists in version 2.3.5.
Where, specifically? I don't see it.
$ curl -O https://kojipkgs.fedoraproject.org//packages/gkrellm/2.3.5/22.fc23/x86_64/gkrellm-devel-2.3.5-22.fc23.x86_64.rpm $ rpmdev-extract gkrellm-devel-2.3.5-22.fc23.x86_64.rpm $ grep -i libs gkrellm-devel-2.3.5-22.fc23.x86_64/usr/lib64/pkgconfig/gkrellm.pc (nothing)
And besides, I don't know what Libs would contain here. There's no library to link with in gkrellm.
Sorry, my fault. There's a"Libs:" line only in Windows. So, it's perfect the way it is!
